alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 15 at 4:36PM MST until August 15 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 436 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Florence to near Magma to near San Tan Valley to near Gold Canyon, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 196 and 211. AZ Route 87 near mile marker 150. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Apache Junction, Gold Canyon, Queen Creek, Chandler Heights, San Tan Mountain Park, Magma, San Tan Valley, and Gold Camp. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
